questions.question: The driver felt sluggish …………………………….. he had lost a lot of blood.
questions.description: Because gives the reason for something.

questions.question: ……………………………… you are busy, I will wait in the lobby.
…………………………… he is too short, he cannot be a police officer.
It is neither a dog …………………………… a fox.
I can’t walk ……………………………. I have broken my leg.
questions.description: Because gives the reason for something.

questions.question: You are going to wear that dress ……………………………. you don’t like it.
questions.description: Even if refers to present or future.

questions.question: ……………………………………… it was a balmy Sunday, I didn’t go out.
I will not forgive her, ………………………………… she apologizes.
He ran so fast ……………………………. I could not catch up with him.
questions.description:
Note the pattern so...that...
So shows the cause and that indicates the effect.

questions.question: The higher you climb, ………………………….. it gets.
questions.description: The comparative is used in both clauses in this structure.

questions.question: …………………………. he was the most eligible candidate, he didn’t get the job.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: This is the girl …………………………….. we are talking about.
questions.description: Who is possible here in an informal style.
